description:
In case of errors during Hyper-V job executions, the corresponding message is not logged properly. 

The following message is shown in the log instead of the actual error details.

This object does not support enumeration

Here's an example providing a full stack trace:

http://pastebin.com/BDQxd0Lc
title: Error reporting in job execution on Hyper-V driver is not working properly

comments.content:
In case of errors during Hyper-V job executions the LOG.debug info reported is not working and returns the following message instead of the actual error details.

This object does not support enumeration

Here's a full stack trace example

http://pastebin.com/BDQxd0Lc
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~alexpilotti

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/16313

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/16313
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/e0a25b83c63feac4752f623bb2715fffc825478b
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit e0a25b83c63feac4752f623bb2715fffc825478b
Author: Alessandro Pilotti <email address hidden>
Date:   Fri Nov 16 17:53:49 2012 +0200

    Fixes an error reporting bug on Hyper-V
    
    Fixes Bug #1079739
    
    In case of errors during Hyper-V job executions, error reporting is not working
    properly due to a bug in the way in which the message is formatted.
    
    This fix handles the formatting properly for any type of WMI job.
    
    Change-Id: Ife2756d42d14e19d9e7f204c317adc248025041a
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
